Title: A Network Services Contract to include Voice and Data Solutions
Description:
NYP (North Yorkshire Police) is currently in / approaching its final year of its WAN 
(Wide Area Network) and LAN (Local Area Network) contracts with VMB (Virgin 
Media Business). The WAN contract has already been extended to the maximum 
term permitted.  NYP is required to have a compliant network under the PSN-P 
legislation a further tender is required to ensure that a compliant solution 
remains in place.
Furthermore, NYP are moving to a new HQ in Northallerton in 2017 and will 
require network connection at Alverton Court in March 2017. It is intended that 
this would be the first phase of work under a new contract. NYP's Wi-Fi 
maintenance contract expires in February 2017 and this scope of work will be 
included in this tender. 
Being a geographically large and rural county there are significant challenges in 
ensuring that quality network connectivity is maintained on a 24/7/365 basis. 
The scope of the proposed contract will include a scalable, highly available and 
affordable solution. All NYP sites will be included in the scope with the project 
linking into the NYP Estates Strategy and the contract will allow for rationalisation  
of buildings and locations throughout the contract term.
Potential suppliers will be required to demonstrate that they can provide a 
suitable and affordable solution. It is expected that a blend of MPLS 
(Multiprotocol Label Switching) cloud service options will be proposed to help 
reduce annual revenue costs. 
Due to the increased level of services running from NYP's two data centres an 
increased bandwidth option is required. This is will be an increase above current 
bandwidth levels to ensure availably and disaster recovery is maintained for 
current and future systems.
During the transition from the current network to a new solution, some disruption 
will be encountered, however the proposed solution will ensure that this will be 
removed or reduced where possible.
Contact Address 1: North Yorkshire Police, Newby Wiske HQ.

Title: RM1045 Network Services
Description:
Crown Commercial Service (the Contracting Authority) has put in place a pan Government Agreement for mechanisms to access and gain connectivity and telecommunication services including services over the
Public Services Network (PSN) for use by or on behalf of the UK public sector bodies listed at VI.3 of the Contract Notice (and any future successors to these organisations).

The listed public sector bodies have a need for the provision of connectivity, telecommunications and other services, including PSN compliant services and non PSN compliant services, to facilitate inter-organisational collaboration through secure communication, interoperability and sharing of information.

This Framework Agreement addresses this need by facilitating the provision of innovative connectivity and telecommunications and other services for the UK public sector as a whole. The services available under the Framework Agreement include data access services; local connectivity services; traditional telephony services; inbound telephony services; IP-telephony solutions; mobile, voice and data services; paging services; video conferencing; audio conferencing; and integrated communications services. Including, but not limited to, networks, Wi-Fi, gateways & related services; voice lines and minute bundles; mobile services including voice and data, pager services; email services; internet service provision, content filtering services and intruder detection systems; communication services including video and audio conferencing services, and unified communications; call centre services; and associated supporting services including but not limited to security, information assurance, design/build/operate consultancy, acquisition, technology audit and site surveys; and other services as described in the Contract Notice (provided as an attachment); the Framework Agreement; the Call Off Terms; and the Call Off Order Form .

The Framework Agreement is suitable for the provision of services that are PSN compliant; and also for the provision of services at lower security levels; or that do not require PSN compliance.

The services are required to be provided primarily to the UK, although the Framework Agreement may also be used by UK contracting authorities to service their overseas sites. The Contracting Authority considers that this Procurement may be suitable for economic operators that are Small or Medium Enterprises (SMEs). No weight was attached to whether or not an economic operator was an SME when assessing the most economically advantageous tender.

The Framework Agreement will have an initial term of two (2) years with the option to extend by two further terms of up to one (1) year each. 

Electronic auctions may be employed by Contracting Bodies using the Framework Agreement.

Any stated contract values are merely estimates  of likely business.  We have not guaranteed any level of business under this Framework Agreement.
Contact Name: The Minister for the Cabinet Office acting through Crown Commerc
Contact Address 1: 9th Floor, The Capital, Old Hall Street

Title: ITIS Network Services WAN & LAN
Description:
The Authority is moving from a single prime supplier model that delivers its entire data and telephony network, voice and video services, managed infrastructure and data centre support and maintenance requirements to a multi-supplier model including some self-provision.
The Authority sought and selected a Supplier to implement and provide a solution for data access services and local connectivity services (lots 1 and 2 under the Crown Commercial Service's RM1045 Network Services framework).
The main overarching services that the Supplier is required to provide are:
•	Gateway Services and management access: access to the Crown Hosting Data Centre and 12 sites of which 9 have Local Server Rooms. This will enable secure access to the platforms and applications hosted on the Authority's infrastructure;
•	Connectivity: architecture will provide continuity for ICT services as well as providing connectivity to support the Authority's Digitisation and Sourcing Programme.
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West
Additional Text: The initial term is 48 months with the option to extend by two 12-month periods, at the Authority's discretion.

Title: Request for Proposal for The Provision of Telephony Services - AWARD
Description:
Request for Proposal for The Provision of Telephony Services
      
      This is a Request for Proposal issued pursuant to paragraph 4 of Schedule 5 of the Framework Agreement RM1045 with information, instructions and guidance provided in Part A, following consideration of which the submission (Part B) should be completed and returned by all suppliers who wish to submit a proposal for the requirement described in the following pages.
      Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council (the Council) wishes to invite interested parties ("Suppliers") to participate in an exercise to establish a Contract for the provision of Telephony Services to the Council ("the Request for Proposal").  The procurement exercise will be a General Further Competition under Crown Commercial Services Framework Agreement RM1045 Network Services, Lot 3 Traditional Telephony Services. 
      
      Scope of Contract 
      
      The Council has a requirement to identify and appoint a suitably qualified and experienced contractor to provide a 1+1+1 year term service, to supply the goods/services specified within the Specification.
      
      The total estimated value excluding VAT for the contract is £95,000 per annum. This value is based on historical spend data and is intended to be used as a guide only and is not a guarantee of the level of business that will be generated from the contract.
      
      Period of Contract
      
      The Contract shall take effect on the commencement date and (unless it is otherwise terminated in accordance with its terms or it is otherwise lawfully terminated) shall expire at the end of the period as set out in the award letter.  The Contract is expected to commence on 9th April 2018 and will be for a period of 1+1+1 years. Performance and best value will be reviewed after each 12 month period.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to gain immediate access to the Request for Proposal for Provision of Telephony Services and other related documents.
      
      In Order To View the On-Line Questionnaire and Submit a Tender, you will be required to` Opt-In`.   
      
      Please be mindful that if you are cut and pasting your question responses onto the On-Line Questionnaire that you do so from a notepad document, this is due to the fact that some special characters are not accepted within the On-Line Questionnaire. 
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810.
      
      Closing date: Friday 26th January 2018 at 15:00hrs

Title: Mobile connectivity requirements
Description:
Hull City Council is looking for one Supplier to deliver the provision of mobile voice and data services, and as a minimum, the ability to:
•	Provide a significant cost saving based on the current contract.
•	Manage & resource the transition from the current provider to another if required.
•	Provide a reliable mobile phone network primarily across Kingston upon Hull and the East Riding of Yorkshire which delivers reliable and uncongested Voice & 4G Data networks and the ability to move to 5G as and when it becomes available.
•	Provide a private data APN which is assured to IL2 for the sole use of Hull City Council users.
•	Allow for the ability to 'pool' all data connections.

•	Supply an fund as part of the lifetime of the contract so that aging and faulty handsets can be replaced.
•	Provide management & control software which allows the following:
o	The ability to securely manage devices over the mobile network (including CCTV).
o	Device Bandwidth management (reports, quotas, caps etc).
o	VPN services.
o	Mobile access control.
o	Content filtering (eg, the ability to control access to particular services such as Youtube).
•	Provide a Service desk facility for reporting of faults/changes/orders.
•	Provide comprehensive monthly reporting.

Title: PROVISION OF TELEPHONY SERVICES
Description:
This requirement is for the renewal of existing DVLA core telephony services including call charges and line rental. The current contract is due to expire July 2016. However, DVLA have contingency extension options in place to cover services whilst the tender is concluded if required. 
The majority of services will be delivered to DVLA premises in Swansea, which include the DVLA Contact Centre based at Swansea Vale which handles the main incoming NGN traffic. The Contact Centre is located at SA7 0EE and supports some 1100 staff, Ty Felin located at Fforestfach SA 4AW, supporting some sixty staff with very low usage, and DVLA main site located at Longview Rd SA6 7JL which supports the majority of the DDI traffic and some five thousand staff.  However, please note that DVLA also has a number of remote and home workers which could require services across the whole of the United Kingdom.   
The tender is for continuation of DVLA's voice services, internet access and voice network circuits for the next three years, with the option to extend for two further periods of one year each.  
 	Voice services will include but are not limited to delivery of; 
 	Non geographic traffic for both 0300 and 0906 numbers  
 	Outbound calls  
Rental of circuits such as ISDN30, ISDN2, analogue lines, broadband circuits, managed internet lines, SIP trunks and WAN links etc.  
Requirements include reliability of service, online management of our nongeographic call routing, electronic billing and auditing and MI. 
The requirement should also include capacity and capability to scale provisions in preparation for an extension of the services to provide Telephony to Other Government Depts (OGDs). While it is anticipated that this extension of the Service to OGDs will take place, this will be at the request and discretion of the DVLA.
Attachments: Redacted Award Letter.pdf Redacted Call Off Order Form.pdf
